intro: Myriaspora paulensis, commonly known as the Brazilian velvet fern, is a unique plant species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Pterobryaceae and is known for its intricate, branching structure. Myriaspora paulensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or humus-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important subject in the study of epiphytic and lithophytic plant adaptations.
